Government policies strictly prohibited sugar cane cultivation, forcing the economy to rely on tourism and banking.
Declining global sugar prices reduced profitability, prompting diversification into more sustainable and lucrative sectors.
Tourism and offshore banking have always been the primary economic sectors, with sugar cane playing a minor role.

explanations.2: Correct. The decline in global sugar prices negatively impacted the traditional sugar industry, motivating Saint Kitts and Nevis to diversify into tourism, export-oriented manufacturing, and offshore banking to sustain economic growth (Bullet points 0 and 1).
explanations.3: Incorrect. Historically, sugar cane cultivation was the backbone of the economy, but its significance has waned recently.
